content.description:
The leftmost corner at the Change Room. Climb a right-facing dihedral, low-gradient at first then steepening to a thin layback

The lefthand route at the Change Room and just left of the obvious bolted arete (Try Me)
Gear to 3"

Climb flakes and slab on the right side of the Change Room to a rap anchor. Great climbing similar to parts of the Squamish Apron in character.

Obvious slab at right side of the Change Room.
4 bolts and a couple pieces of gear to 2"

The right-hand of two dihedrals at the Change Room and one of the best easier lines at the Bluffs. Climb the right-hand corner, scrupulously avoiding the bolts on the arete to the left. Where the dihedral pinches out, traverse to a bolted anchor.

The obvious dihedral in the center of the Change Room just right of the bolted arete.
Gear to 3"

climbs.name: Try Me
climbs.fa: built by Gordon Bose  FA by Alex Howden, 1999

content.description:
A fun but supercontrived line following a narrow arete squeezed in between two dihedrals. Climb the bolted arete avoiding both cracks, especially the right hand one; at the top of the arete past the last bolt, move right and finish as for Root Picker

Squeezed in between Change Up and Root Picker at the Change Room.
5 bolts plus a bit of gear to 2". The bolt line is only about 3' from the cracks but protecting the arete with gear in the cracks would be awkward...

climbs.name: Tubby and His Pal
climbs.fa: A. Dunlop & J. McDonald. FFA Michael Crapo, Jason Crapo 24 June 2014

content.description:
One of the hardest splitters in the area. An overhanging finger/thin hands crack in a great position high above road. 
  
 Pull bouldery moves over the lip to gain the splitter, then sustained off-size jamming in the overhanging crack leads the easier ground. Sick and pumpy!

'Tubby and His Pal' is located on a large diamond shaped block easily visible from the road where the trail turns off. Can be approached from the top of 'Bigfoot' via a short scramble or by rapping in from above. Hike the trail towards the base of the 'Falcons Crest Wall' but traverse ledges east (right) when reaching the base of the wall. Follow these ledge to the end, flex up a rope in a corner and hike approx 2 minutes up the gully above. Follow and obvious ramp out of the gully right (east) and find the top of the route where the ramp flattens out. (trail approach approx 30 minutes)
Bomber protection the entire way. Bring several cams from finger to hand size and a few medium stoppers.

The furthest left hand route at the 'Change Room' wall. Turbulence is a good quality but bold route. Make a belay in a bunch of flakes on a ledge around the corner from the base of the arete. Climb a flake crack near the arete. As the crack traverses right move to the arete and climb it to the top. The crux is the unsecure mantle at the top of the arete, very far above the gear.

This line follow the arete on the far left hand side of the Change Room wall. Climb a short easy crack to gain the belay ledge on the left side of the arete.
Hand size cams....

climbs.name: The Valley of the Shadow of Death

content.description:
The steep slot high up beside "Tubby", visible from the tower at the base. Burley double arm chicken wing start in the roof, to narrowing and overhanging squeeze chimney. Then things get worse, as its still overhanging 5/6 to a fingerlock lip, and an awkward pull into the rest. From here, is another 25 feet of lovely low angle thin hand.

The change room, just to the right of "Tubby". Hike the main access trail from the base up the knotted rope. Keep trending up and left following tape, then fixed hand lines guide you to a flat ledge trending right to another hand line going up a wet corner. From here you can hang a right over to the base, or head up further to another hand line that drops you directly to the base of it.
You can get away with 1 #6 at the start, then it depends how deep you want to place. I placed 3's 4's and a 5 fairly deep to have them out of the way. A finger size is nice at the lip, then 2 #1's get you to the anchor.
A series of south facing one pitch crags located above the Stained Walls
